item.title: Ordinal Models Likert Scale Data
item.description: Background I was recently tasked with providing support to a study where the primary outcome was an eight-item, seven-point Likert scale. The proposal was to use a t-test to undertake the analysis. Being unfamiliar with the analysis of Likert scale responses I decided to do a bit of research into what was standard practice. There appears to be disagreement about whether the appropriate analysis should be based on parametric or non-parametric methods (Sullivan and Artino Jr 2013).
